section.text: Any person authorized to enforce this ordinance are hereby empowered to request and receive from the tribal conservation department or a tribal harvest registration station information regarding permit issuance and any other necessary harvest related data or information.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.4.070 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.407

para.text: If the tribal court finds that any member or duly authorized non-member who, for himself or herself, or by his or her agent, servant or employee, or who as an agent, servant or employee of another, violates this ordinance, the member or non-member shall be liable as follows:
For all violations for which no other amount is specified, a civil remedial forfeiture of not more than $5,000.00;
For any violation, attendance of cultural education classes;
For any violation, a revocation or suspension of off-reservation hunting, fishing, trapping or gathering privileges for a period of time within the discretion of the court;

For any violation, a civil remedial forfeiture of any property, including boats, motors, vehicles, hunting or fishing equipment, or other property, used in the commission of the violation of this ordinance;
For all violations, the court may order a natural resources assessment not to exceed 75% of the amount of the civil remedial forfeiture; and
For all violations, appropriate court costs within the discretion of the court.

Any member or duly authorized non-member who fails to pay any fine assessed by the tribal court within thirty (30) days after the fine has been assessed and who fails to make other arrangements regarding payment of the fine, shall owe, in addition to the fine imposed, $10.00 for each thirty (30) Day period that the fine is overdue.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.4.080 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.408

section.heading: Enhancement of Forfeiture and Penalties
section.text: Upon conviction of any member or duly authorized non-member for a violation of this ordinance when such person has been convicted of a previous violation of this ordinance within a period of one year, the court may enhance any civil remedial forfeiture or other penalty as the court deems appropriate.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.4.090 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.409

section.heading: Civil Damages
section.text: In addition to any other penalty allowed by this ordinance, the tribal court may award to the Tribe or, in addition to an action to impose penalties, the Tribe may bring a civil action for recovery of, damages against any person unlawfully killing, wounding, catching, taking, trapping, or having unlawfully in possession any of the following named protected miscellaneous forest products, wild rice, wild animals, or any part thereof, and the sum assessed for damages for each miscellaneous forest product, wild rice, or wild animal, shall not be less than the amount stated in this section:

para.text: Any endangered and threatened species protected under this ordinance, $875.00.
Any fisher, prairie chicken or sand hill crane, $262.50.
Any deer, moose, elk or bear, $75.00.
Any bobcat, cougar, fox, beaver or otter, $87.50.
Any coyote, raccoon or mink, $43.75.
Any sharptail grouse, ruffed grouse, spruce grouse, wild duck, coot, wild goose or brant, $26.25.
Any pheasant, Hungarian partridge, bobwhite, quail, rail, Wilson's snipe, woodcock or shorebird, or protected song bird or harmless bird, $17.50.
Any muskrat, rabbit or squirrel, $8.75.
Any muskellunge or rock or lake sturgeon, $43.75.
Any largemouth or smallmouth bass, $26.25.
Any brook, rainbow, brown, or steelhead trout, $26.25.
Any walleye, northern pike, or any other game fish not mentioned in pars. (9) to (11), $8.75.
Any wild animal, wild rice, or miscellaneous forest product not mentioned in pars. (2) to (8), $17.50.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.4.100 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.410

section.heading: Seized Wild Animals Wild Rice, and Miscellaneous Forest Products
section.text: No wild animal, wild rice, or miscellaneous forest product seized pursuant to this ordinance shall be returned to a convicted violator, his or her immediate family, or other member of the hunting, fishing, trapping or gathering party.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.4.110 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.411

section.heading: Schedule of Money Penalties; No Contest
section.text: The Tribal Court, in consultation with the Tribal Governing Board, may adopt a schedule of forfeitures to be imposed by the Court upon the receipt of an admission that a violation of this ordinance has occurred, or a plea of no contest, which may be done either in person or in writing. This schedule shall not bind the Court as to forfeitures assessed by the Court after adjudicating a violation where the defendant has entered a plea of not guilty.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.4.120 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.412

section.heading: Collection of Money Penalties
section.text: Enforcement of the money penalties imposed pursuant to this ordinance may be had through the collection of penalties from funds of the violator held by the Tribe, through the imposition of community service work requirements in lieu of money payment, through debt collection mechanisms of the courts of other jurisdictions, or through any other method authorized by law.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.4.130 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.413

para.text: Whoever is concerned in the commission of a violation of this ordinance shall be deemed a principal and may be charged with the violation although he or she did not directly commit it and although the member or non-member who directly committed it has not been convicted of the violation.
A member or duly authorized non-member is concerned in the commission of the violation if the member or duly authorized non-member:
Directly commits the violation;
Aids or abets the commission of it; or
Is a party to a conspiracy with another to commit it, or advises, hires, or counsels or otherwise procures another to commit it.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.4.140 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.414

section.heading: Harvesting After Revocation or Suspension
section.text: No member or duly authorized non-member whose hunting, fishing, trapping or gathering privileges have been revoked or suspended pursuant to Section CSV.1.4.080(a)(3) of this ordinance, shall assist, hunt, fish, trap or gather any miscellaneous forest product, wild rice, or wild animal, the harvest of which is regulated by this ordinance, during such revocation or suspension.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.4.150 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.415

section.heading: Interference with Department
section.text: No member or non-member shall knowingly interfere with or hinder or restrict wardens of the tribal conservation department or officers of the tribal law enforcement department or any other law enforcement department or agency from which the tribal conservation department has sought assistance, in the exercise of authority or performance of duties under this ordinance.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.4.160 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.416

section.heading: Manoomin Gakinoo'amaagewin
section.text: Miinawaa gaye o gaa-izhi-wiindamawind aw anishinaabe o`apii dabwaa-dagoshing aw gaa-waabishkiwed. Niizhwaaso gii-tagoshinoog ezhi-manidoowaadiziwaad gii-wiindamawindwaa anishinaabe aaniin keyaa ewiiyan ezhi-wii-ezhiwebak ingoding wii-tagoshin waayaabishkiiwed. Mii iwidi gii-wiindamawindwaa ya`o waa-tibaadidamaan. Gaawiin gii-ozhimosiiwag anishinaabeg. Ogii-maamiginaawaan gakina izhi-miinindwaa midenid, midewinid ayaabajitood owe ge gimishomisinaan dewe`igan, zhiishiigwanan, midewayaanan gakina gegoo ayaabajichigaadeg midewind anishinaabe. Mii gaa-izhi-ombinigaadeg mii dash gaa-izhi-maajaawaad imaa keyaa gii-pi-onaawinidiwaad idash dabwa-bi-maajaawaad dash aw manoomini-anishinaabe, manoomini-anishinaabe noongom ezhi-gikenimind mii agiwaa gii-miinaawag yo'oh manoomin, manidoo-manoomin ezhinikaadeg omaa manidowaadad gii-wiindamawaan anishinaabe iw wapii odi keyaa ningaabii`anong ezhaayan. Baanimaa dagoshinan iwidi badakideg, agoondeg agoondeg iiwo manidoo-manoomin. Mii imaa, mii imaa ajiwaa da-gikendameg gaye giinawaa gidandishinaabe-akiimiwaa gaa-ayaamagak. Mii gaa izhi-wiindamawindwaa. Wiinitamiwaa dash agiw manoominini-anishinaabeg, mii o gaa-pi-dakonamowaad. Mashkimod igo dibishkoo mashkimod izhi-gikendamang.

Wiigwaas idash i`ii miinawaa nagamonan, manidoo-nagamonan miinawwa gaye awiiya bineshiinh manoominkeshiiyen ezhinikaazod. Mii ya`aw, mii ya`aw odaa naasaab gaa gaa-pazigwaa imaa gaa-pagizigwa'od i`iw apii gii-pamid gii-pi-maajaawaad manidoog. Manidoo-manoomin gii-pi-nanda-waabandamowaad. Mii dash geyaabi ezhi-gikendamang. Manidoo-wiisiniwin, manidoo ogii-pagidinaan i`iw manoomin onjidaa anishinaabe, onjidaa giinawind ezhi-ojibwemoyang ezhi-boodawaadamiig gaye miinawaa manoom miinawaa odaawaag miinawaa manoominiig miinawaa gaye giinawaa ozhaawaanii ezhinikaazowaad. Miinawaa gaye wiinawaa gaa-kikapoo gaa-izhinkaazowaad anishinaabeg. Mii`yenh mii gaa-izhi-miinindwaa yo manidoo...manidoo-wiisiniwin ezhi-manidoowaadak i`iw manoomin. Mii imaa wenzikaamagak gaawiin bakaan, gaawiin bakaan gaye gidaa-mikanziimin i`iw mii iw i`iw manoomin gaa-izhi-miinind Anishinaabe. Mii dash i`yo gaa-izhi-wiindawind Anishinaa weweni ganawendaman yi`o manoomin miinawaa naasaab gaye giin ezhi-ganawenimigoyan. Gaawiin wiikaa da-maadaasinoon i`iw manoomin giishpin weweni weweni ganawendaman. Weweni gaye asemaakeyan dabwa-booziyan jiimaaning. Weweni awiiya da-ganoonaad manidoon yi`ow manidoo ezhi-manidoowaadizid imaa nibiikaang. Mii ya`aw ge-noonind dabwaa dabwaa-boozid awiiiya omaa jiimaaning. Da-wii-maaminigaadeg i`iw manoomin weweni weweni pane da-manaajitooyan kina gegoo. Mii gaa-izhi-wiindamaagoyang. Pane da-mikwendamind, gego wiikaa wanenimaaken aw manidoo.

Aw manidoo gaa-pagidendang yo omaa akiing da-biijikaamigak manoomin. Mii dash iw wenji-asemaakeyang geyaabi bimiwidoodyang yo`o midewaajimon. Geyaabi da-gikendamang, gaawiin eta go da-mikwendamang da-gikendamang gaawiin naasaab i`iw debinaak, gaawiin debinaak da-minikwendamang, da-gikendamang mii ezhi-wiindamaagoyang. Mii dash a`aw asemaa giishpin asemaa weweni aabaji' aabaji`ang i`iw dabwaa-mamooyang yi`iw manoomin. Mii imaa wiindamawigeyang ezhi-miigwechiwitaagoziyang geyaabi o ezhi-manidoowaadak manoomin da-miigwechiwitaagoziwin. Mii omaa ge gii-wiindamaagemin weweni wii-kanawendamang weweni wii-izhitooyang gaawiin gidaa-manaajitoosiimin, gaawiin gidaswewebitoosiimin. Gaawiin gaye giwebinanziimin weweni giga-ganawendaamin da-wiisiniyang da-ashamang a`aw giniijaanisiminaang, da-ashamang gaye a`aw bekaded anishinaabe.

Weweni idash ezhi-wiindamaageyaan nimisiwendaan iwidi keyaa niigaan da-gikendang anishinaabe yo, yo gaa-miinind gaa-miinigoyang da-ganawendamang ezhi-manidoowaadak yo`o, yo`o wiisiniwin. Geget...geget gi-mino-ayaamin gi-mino-bimaadizimin gikendamang ano giigidowinan gaa-izhi-miinigoyang gaye`ii midewaajimon. Weweni dash nimisawendaan geget weweni da-noondang y`ow ezhi-naajimoyaan gaye niin. Gaawiin anishaa ni-izhichigesii. Miinawaa gaawiin, gaawiin ninagowenimaasii awiiya niin. Weweni nimiinaa ya`o ezhi-dibaajimoyaan kina oshkinaj-anishinaabe. O niijaanis miinawaa ongow anishinaabeg owid keyaa niigaan waa-ondaadizijig. Miigwech yi`o taagozi dash ishkwaaj niin dibaajimoyaan.

annotation.text: As the Anishinaabe was told before the white man arrived. There were seven spirits that came to tell the Anishinaabe about what was going to happen with the coming of the white man. These are the teachings that were given that I am going to talk about. The Anishinaabe did not walk away from it. They gathered all the mide teachings, the objects they used such as our grandfather drum, our rattles, mide items and all that is used for the midewiwin. They lifted their sacred items and they all left from there together before the Menominee Indians left, the ones that are known as such they were given the rice, the sacred rice that is called the anishinaabe was told to travel towards the west. As you arrive where it stands, where it lays in the water that sacred rice. This is where you will know the land that is for the Indian will be. This is what they were told. The Menominee where the first to bring the rice (to us…). It was in a sack, as we know of it.

Then in birch bark and the songs, spirit songs and the wild rice bird that is called. That wild rice bird, that same one that flew up with the spirits as they were leaving. As they come and check it out, looked at it. And this is how we still know it. This sacred food, the spirit put it here for the Indian, for the Ojibwe, for the Potawatomie and the Odawa and the Menominee and the Shawnee that are called. And also the Kickapoo Indians that are called as such. This is spirit food that was given by the spirit. This is where it came from, you will not find anywhere else, that which was given to the Anishinaabe. The Anishinaabe was told to take care of the rice and the rice will take care of you. The rice will never disappear as long as you take great care of it. And also offer your tobacco before you get into a canoe. Someone will speak to the spirit…that spirit that is in the water. This is the one that you speak to before you get into the canoe. As we proceed to pick rice…you shall respect all things. This is what we were told. Always remember the spirit, never forget the spirit.

The creator is the one that put this rice to be growing here on earth. That is why we offer tobacco so that we carry on these sacred teachings. To know these teachings, not only to think about it but to know it, not any ole way, not to think about them in any ole way, but to really know the teachings, this is what we were told. That is why tobacco is used before the rice is picked. This where we give our thanks for the sacredness of the rice, as we give thanks. This where we give our thanks to take care of and to make it we are not doing enough to take care of it, we don't give enough voice to it. We do not waste any of it, we take great care of it so that we can feed our children, so that we can feed the ones that are hungry.

As I give these teachings, I want this to be carried on so that the Anishinaabe will know this that was given as we take care of the sacredness of the food. We lead a good life when we remember the sacred teachings that we were given. I wish my teaching to be carried on to those that hear this. I do not do this for nothing. And I am not trying to step over the boundaries of other's teachings. I give my teachings with respect to all the young people. And the future generation. I give thanks whenever I finish a teaching.

annotations.annotation: Wild Rice Teaching by Bawdwaywidun (Eddie Benton) from Dibaajimowinan: Anishinaabe Stories of Culture and Respect, Great Lakes Indian Fish and Wildlife Commission, Odanah, WI: July 2013.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.5.010 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.501

para.text: Recognition. There hereby is created a Tribal Wild Rice Authority which shall have the powers and duties enumerated in this subchapter.

Definition. As used in this subchapter, "Tribal Wild Rice Authority" shall mean the individuals named by the Tribal Governing Board to act in the manner of the traditional Rice Chiefs for the purposes of implementing the provisions of this subchapter and of regulating the harvest and conservation of wild rice.
Powers. The Tribal Wild Rice Authority may:

Designate the open and closed dates for harvesting of wild rice growing within the exterior boundaries of the Lac Courte Oreilles Reservation and off-reservation lands under the jurisdiction and purview of the Lac Courte Oreilles Tribe by posting notice of the open dates on the shores of and at places of access to such waters and/or at the tribal conservation department; and

For conservation purposes, establish a closed season for the harvesting of wild rice on any body of water within the exterior boundaries of the Lac Courte Oreilles Reservation and off-reservation lands under the jurisdiction and purview of the Lac Courte Oreilles Tribe.

Sufficient Notice of Opening Dates. If the Tribal Wild Rice Authority designates the open and closed dates for harvesting of wild rice growing within the exterior boundaries of the Lac Courte Oreilles Reservation and off-reservation lands under the jurisdiction and purview of the Lac Courte Oreilles Tribe, the posting of an open date for harvesting wild rice pursuant to Section CSV.1.5.020(c) shall be deemed sufficient notice of such opening date and no other publication thereof is required.

Consultation Required. In exercising its powers and duties under Section CSV.1.5.020(c), the Tribal Wild Rice Authority shall consult with and obtain the advice and recommendations of the Tribal Governing Board and the tribal conservation department..

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.5.020 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.502

section.heading: Permit Required
section.text: No member or duly authorized non-member shall harvest or gather wild rice pursuant to this subchapter without possessing a valid wild rice harvesting permit approved by the Tribal Governing Board which may incorporate such other terms and conditions as the tribal conservation department deems necessary or appropriate. Such a permit may be the member's tribal identification card required by Section CSV.1.3.030(c) of this ordinance. No wild rice harvest permit is required of helpers of a permittee who participate only in shore operations.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.5.030 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.503

para.text: Nothing in this ordinance shall be construed to prohibit members from selling wild rice legally harvested pursuant to this ordinance.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.5.040 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.504

para.text: No member or duly authorized non-member shall harvest or gather wild rice by the use of any method other than smooth, rounded cedar rods or sticks which are held and operated by hand.

No member or duly authorized non-member shall bind or otherwise bundle together any wild rice stalks, or harvest or gather any wild rice, the stalks of which have been bound or otherwise bundled together, except by special permit issued by the Tribal Governing Board.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.5.050 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.505

section.heading: Boats
section.text: Except as otherwise authorized by the Tribal Governing Board, no member or duly authorized non-member may harvest or gather any wild rice by the use of any boat longer than 18 feet or wider than 38 inches, or with any modification of the gunwale designed to capture rice outside of the boat, or by the use of any boat propelled by other than muscular power using only a push pole or canoe paddle.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.5.060 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.506

para.text: There is no closed season for the harvest of wild rice on any body of water on the reservation as defined in Section CSV.1.2.010(ddd) of this ordinance except for the following:
Any other body of water for which the Tribal Wild Rice Authority has established a closed season pursuant to Section CSV.1.5.020(c) of this ordinance.

No member shall harvest or gather wild rice in any body of water for which there is a closed season pursuant to Section CSV.1.5.070(a), except during the time(s) as such body of water is posted open by the Tribal Wild Rice Authority pursuant to Section CSV.1.5.020(c)(1) of this ordinance.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.5.070 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.507

section.heading: Hours
section.text: No member shall harvest or gather wild rice on any body of water on the reservation as defined in Section CSV.1.2.010(ddd) of this ordinance between sunset and the following 9:00 a.m., Central Time.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.5.080 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.508

section.heading: Harvest Monitoring
section.text: No member shall refuse to cooperate with wild rice harvest monitoring activities conducted by the tribal conservation department.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.5.090 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.509

section.heading: Harvest by Authorized Officials
section.text: Nothing in this subchapter shall prohibit or preclude the tribal conservation department or their designees from harvesting or gathering wild rice for scientific purposes or otherwise within the performance of their duties.

section.heading: Assistance by Non-Members
section.text: No person who is not a member or a duly authorized non-member shall assist a member in the gathering of wild rice pursuant to this ordinance except as provided Section CSV.1.3.290 of this ordinance.

Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.5.110 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.511

section.heading: Awesiinyag Mendidojib Gidizhitwaawininaan
section.text: Ingoding gii-taawag aanind anishinaabe iwidi Manoominikaang. Gaawiin gegoo ogii-misawndanziinaawaan. Ogii-mamoonaawaan eta waa-aabajitoowaad miinawaa gii-ashangewag (wiikongewag) da-miigwechiwi'iwewaad.

Baanimaa ogii-ani-wanendaanaawaan odizhitwaawiniwaan. Gaawiin geyaabi gii-paatayiinosiiwag giigoonyag. Gaawiin dash geyaabi gii-minoginzinoonan ogitigaaniwaan. Gii-ani-maajaawag waawaashkeshiinyag. Gii-ani-gawanaandam Anishinaabe.

Bezhig anishinaabe ogii-naanaagadawendaan gaa-izhi-maazhiseg. Ogii-kikenimaan ezhi-maajaawaad gaagaagiin miinawaa aandegwan. Ogii-ineminaan iniw waawaashkeshiinyan izhi-biminizha'aawaad. Gii-ani-kii'igoshimo gaye wiin gaa-izhi-biminizha'aad iniw bineshiinyan Giiwedinong akeyaa.

Eshkam gii-shaagwiiwii biminizha'iwed. Gegapii gii-wanendamaa. Ojiichaagwan dash geyaabi giiwedinong akeyaa gii-izhaawan ganawenimigod gidoodeminaanig. Gii-tagoshin noopiming gii-tazhi-maawanji'idinid bineshiinyan.

Ogii-kagwejimaan, "Aaniin gaa-onji-makamiyaang waawaashkeshiinyag? Nindapenimonodawaanaanig da-wiisiniyaang miinawaa da-biizikiiganikeyaang." Ogii-nakwetaagoon: "Gaawiin ningii-izhichigesiimin. Gaye niinawind nindapenimonodawaanaanig da-bimaadiziyaang. Ningii-piminizha'aanaanig gii-maajaawaad. Gigii-nishiwanaajichigem. Gidaa-gaagiizomaawaag. Giga-bagidinigoo da-nazikawadwaa."

Niigaan gii-izhaa ani-waabamaad waawaashkeshiinyan gitigaaning. Gii-ani-mawi naazikawaad iniw ogimaawi-waawaashkeshiinyan. Gii-wiindamaage a'aw waawaashkeshiinh gaa-onji-maajaawaad gii-mino-doodaagosinig anishinaaben. Geget ogii-andodamawaan iniw Ogimaawi-waawaashkeshiinyan da-azhe-giiwenid.

Ogii-wiindamawaan ge-izhi-azhe-giiwed da-gikinoo'amawaad wiijanishinaaben da-gwayako-bimaadizinid. Ogii-apiitenimaawaan iniw anishinaaben epiichi-bagidinamawaad wiijanishinaabeni. Gii-tebwetaadiwag inaakonigewaad da-azhe-giiwewaad. Yo'ow izhichiged, gii-azhe-giiwewan owiiyawing ojichaagwanan. Zhayegwa gii-pi-azhe-giiwewan waawaashkeshiinyan gii-koshkozid.

Gaa-ako-inakamigak ani-maajaawag waawaashkeshiinyag endaso-gikinoonowining ani-ishkwaa-agoojinid aniw Manoominike-giizis(oon) da-dazhimaawaad iniw gaayosenijin gaa-manaaji'igowaajin miinawaa gaa-manaaji'igosiwaanijin. Gaa-manaaji'aajig apane oga-mikawaawaan waawaashkeshiinyan miinawaa da-minosewag.

annotation.text: Big Game Tradition and Custom
There once was an Indian village by a wild rice lake that did not want for anything. The people there only took what they needed and always had feasts to give thanks.

As time went on, though, the people began to forget their traditions. Soon, the fish were not as abundant and their gardens were not as fruitful. Then, the deer disappeared, and the people began to starve.

A man sat down and began to think about what went wrong. He saw that the ravens and crows were leaving and thought that they were leading the deer away. So, the man began to fast and follow the ravens and crows north.

The further he traveled, his body got weaker. Finally, he fell over and lost consciousness, but his soul continued the journey northward, with the clan spirits watching over it. He came across a forest where the ravens and crows had gathered.

He asked them, "Why did you take the deer from us? We rely on them for our food and clothing." The ravens replied: "No, it was not us. We rely on the deer for our lives, so we followed the deer when they left. You were wasteful. You owe the deer people an apology, so we will let you through."

The man continued on and came upon deer in a field. He approached the Boss Deer and began to cry. The Boss Deer told him that it was man's fault that the deer had left. The man begged the Boss Deer to come back to his people.

He promised to go back to his people and teach them to correct their ways. The deer were so moved by the man's sacrifice for his people, they agreed to come back. With this promise, the man's soul returned to his body and when he awoke, the deer had come back.

From then on though, the deer will disappear every year at the end of August in order to discuss which Indian hunters have respected their ways and which have not. Those who have will always find deer and prosper.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.6.010 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.601

para.text: A closed season is hereby established for the hunting of deer except for the open season specified in Section CSV.1.6.060 of this ordinance.

Except as otherwise expressly provided by this ordinance, no member or duly authorized non-member shall hunt deer within the exterior boundaries of the Lac Courte Oreilles Reservation and off-reservation lands under the jurisdiction and purview of the Lac Courte Oreilles Tribe during the closed season.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.6.020 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.602

section.heading: Number of Deer Available for Harvest
section.text: There shall be no limits on the harvest of deer during the open season, except the Tribal Governing Board reserves the right to impose limits that the tribal conservation department determines is in the best interest of the Tribe to do so.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.6.030 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.603

section.heading: Deer Hunting Permits
section.text: No member or duly authorized non-member shall hunt deer pursuant to this subchapter without possessing a valid deer hunting permit approved by the Tribal Governing Board which may incorporate such other terms and conditions as the tribal conservation department deems necessary or appropriate. Such a permit may be the member's tribal identification card required by Section CSV.1.3.030(c) of this ordinance.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.6.040 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.604

para.text: No member or duly authorized non-member who has killed a deer pursuant to this ordinance, shall fail or refuse to provide a harvest report, data, or such other relevant harvest information, as may be requested by a tribal conservation warden, tribal law enforcement officer or the tribal conservation department.

No member or duly authorized non-member shall provide information to a tribal conservation warden, tribal law enforcement officer or the tribal conservation department which the member or duly authorized non-member knows, or has reason to know, is false or misleading.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.6.050 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.605

section.heading: Deer Seasons; Specific Regulations
section.text: Upon the determination of the tribal conservation department and the corresponding approval of the Tribal Governing Board, the deer hunting season may be changed if it is in the best interest of the Tribe to do so. All dates given in this section are inclusive:

para.text: Closed Season for Deer Hunting. Except as provided in Section CSV.1.6.060(c), no member or duly authorized non-member shall hunt deer from the first Monday following New Year's Day to the first Sunday following July 4th.

Open Season. The firearm, bow and crossbow deer hunting season begins on the first Monday following July 4th and ending on the first Sunday following New Year's Day or as otherwise provided by Tribal Governing Board.

Permit Only Season. No member or duly authorized non-member shall hunt deer from June 1st through the first Sunday following July 4th without a permit. Permits will only be issued for yearlings and bucks upon a showing of extreme need pursuant to Section CSV.1.1.100 of this ordinance.

Tradition and Custom. Notwithstanding any other provision of this section, nothing in this section shall be construed to infringe upon the issuance of a permit according to the traditions and custom of the Tribe pursuant to Section CSV.1.1.090 of this ordinance.

Emergency Closure. Notwithstanding any other provision of this section, nothing in this section shall be construed to authorize deer hunting or the opening of a deer hunting season contrary to an Emergency Closure Order issued pursuant to Section CSV.1.3.300 of this ordinance.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.6.060 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.606

section.heading: Permissible Methods
section.text: No member or duly authorized non-member shall hunt deer except by the use of any firearm, bow or crossbow, the use of which is not prohibited by this ordinance.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.6.070 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.607

section.heading: Firearms Restrictions
section.text: No member or duly authorized non-member shall hunt deer by the use of any firearm, except as authorized pursuant to Section CSV.1.3.210(c)(1) of this ordinance.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.6.080 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.608

section.heading: Bow/Crossbow Restrictions
section.text: No member or duly authorized non-member shall hunt deer by the use of any bow or crossbow, except as authorized pursuant to Section CSV.1.3.210(c)(2) of this ordinance.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.6.090 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.609

section.heading: Group Deer Hunting
section.text: Pursuant to Section CSV.1.3.290 of this ordinance, no member or duly authorized non-member shall hunt deer as a member of a group deer hunting when a member of the party is an unauthorized non-member.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.6.100 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.610

section.heading: Hunting Hours
section.text: There shall be no limits on deer hunting hours during the open season, except the Tribal Governing Board reserves the right to impose limits or site specific hunting hours that the tribal conservation department determines is the best interest of the Tribe to do so.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.6.110 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.611

section.heading: Transportation
section.text: Except when a deer is being transported between the exterior boundaries of the Lac Courte Oreilles Reservation and off-reservation lands under the jurisdiction and purview of the Lac Courte Oreilles Tribe, no member or duly authorized non-member shall transport deer off-reservation without a transportation tag pursuant to Section CSV.1.3.120 of this ordinance.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.6.120 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.612

section.heading: Hunting Within Restricted Tribal Areas Prohibited
section.text: Pursuant to Section CSV.1.3.210(a) of this ordinance, no member or duly authorized non-member shall hunt deer within restricted areas.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.6.130 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.613

section.heading: Hunting on Non-Member Fee Lands Prohibited
section.text: Pursuant to Section CSV.1.3.020 of this ordinance, no member or duly authorized non-member shall hunt deer on any non-member fee land except where the non-member land owner has consented to tribal hunting.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.6.140 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.614

section.heading: Sale of Deer and Deer Parts

para.text: Head, Skin and Hooves. Nothing in this ordinance shall be construed to prohibit any member or duly authorized non-member from selling to any person the head, skin and hooves, when severed from the rest of the carcass, of any deer lawfully killed pursuant to this ordinance.

Meat. Pursuant to Section CSV.1.3.260 of this ordinance, no member or duly authorized non-member shall sell meat from deer harvested pursuant to this ordinance except for subsistence uses as defined in Section CSV.1.2.010(sss) of this ordinance.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.6.150 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.615

section.heading: Deer Shining / Night Hunting
section.text: Pursuant to Section CSV.1.3.150 of this ordinance, the use of artificial light for deer hunting is permitted, provided it is not within a safety zone as defined in Section CSV.1.2.010(hhh) of this ordinance. Member and duly authorized non-member compliance with the use of a safe zone of fire as defined in Section CSV.1.2.010(ggg) of this ordinance and an adequate backstop as defined in Section CSV.1.2.010(a) of this ordinance shall be considered safe hunting, otherwise no member or duly authorized non-member shall hunt and shine deer in such a manner so as to put human lives in danger, and a member or duly authorized non-member must take reasonable precautions to refrain from hunting dangerously.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.6.160 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.616

section.heading: Authorization for Closure
section.text: Pursuant to Section CSV.1.3.300 of this ordinance, the Director of the tribal conservation department is thereby delegated the authority to close any area to deer hunting prior to the season's closing date, generally or with respect to a particular location, whenever in his or her professional opinion and judgment the continuation of the harvest is likely to result in a harvest exceeding the Tribe's harvest goals or may otherwise cause biological harm to the tribal deer population.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.6.170 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.617

section.heading: Prohibited Animals
section.text: No member or non-member shall hunt elk, moose, or cougars within the exterior boundaries of the Lac Courte Oreilles Reservation or the off-reservation lands under the jurisdiction and purview of the Lac Courte Oreilles Tribe. Pursuant to Section CSV.1.7.020 of this ordinance, there shall be no general hunting of bears.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.6.180 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.618

section.heading: Trapping Big Game Prohibited
section.text: No member or non-member shall trap or snare big game animals within the exterior boundaries of the Lac Courte Oreilles Reservation or the off-reservation lands under the jurisdiction and purview of the Lac Courte Oreilles Tribe.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.6.190 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.619

section.heading: Use of Dogs in Hunting Big Game

para.text: No member or non-member shall hunt deer, elk or moose with the use of dogs within the exterior boundaries of the Lac Courte Oreilles Reservation or the off-reservation lands under the jurisdiction and purview of the Lac Courte Oreilles Tribe.
A member or duly authorized non-member may use leashed dogs to track wounded game.
A member or duly authorized non-member may shoot a wild-dog that is chasing a deer.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.6.200 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.620

section.heading: Assistance by Non-Members
section.text: No person who is not a member or a duly authorized non-member shall assist a member in the hunting of deer pursuant to this ordinance except as provided Section CSV.1.3.290 of this ordinance.

Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.6.210 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.621

section.heading: Makwag Gidizhitwaawininaan
section.text: Chi-apiitenimaawag makwag. Wiinetawaa awesiinyag izhi-niizhoogaadegaabawiwag anishinaabeng.

Makwa oganawendaanan gidakiiminaan, jiibayaki, miinawaa anishinaaben. Odaa-bagidinigoon awiiya wii-nisaad makwan aniw makwa wedoodeminijin. Nisaad gii-ashangeng da-apiitenimaawaad a'aw makwa miinawaa makwa wedoodemijig.

Gii-aabidizi a'aw makwa akina. Gaawiin gegoo ogii-nishiwanaajitoonaawaan: miijim aawan owiiyaas, owiinowin miinawaa odoonagizhiin gii-inaabadadoon da-mashkiikiikeng miinawaa da-omoodayikeng, miinawaa makozidan gii-inaabadadoon midewigaaning.

Makwa wedoodemijig wiinetawaa gii-pagidinaawag da-aabajitoowaad makwa owiiyawini wiiyaas aawanzinook. Oshtigwaanigegan gii-achigaade makomiikanaang Waabanong inaasamising. Inendaagwad yo'ow keyaa wii-izhi-oshki-bimaadizid a'aw makwa.

annotation.text: Bears Tradition and Custom
Bears are given great respect, as they are the only animal who can stand on two feet, similar to humans.

The bear is the protector of the Earth, Tribe and Burial Grounds. Before taking a bear's life, permission was requested from the Bear Clan. After a bear was killed, a feast was held in honor of the bear and the Bear Clan.
All parts of the bear were used and nothing was wasted: meat for food, fat and entrails for medicine and water containers, and bear paws were used for the fourth degree member of the medicine lodge.
However, only Bear Clan members were allowed to use the non-meat part of the bear. The bear's skull was placed on a bear trail, facing west. It is believed that the bear would then be reborn.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.7.010 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.701

para.text: No member or duly authorized non-member shall hunt bears within the exterior boundaries of the Lac Courte Oreilles Reservation or the off-reservation lands under the jurisdiction and purview of the Lac Courte Oreilles Tribe, except upon a showing of extreme need pursuant to Section CSV.1.1.100 of this ordinance.

Notwithstanding any other provision of this section, nothing in this section shall be construed to infringe upon the issuance of permit according to the traditions and custom of the Tribe pursuant to Section CSV.1.1.090 of this ordinance.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.7.020 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.702

section.heading: Awesiiensag Gidizhitwaawininaan
section.text: Da-ashange anishinaabe nitam nisaad waawaashkeshiinyan. Miinawaa da-ashange nitam nisaad awesiinh egaasaanijin.

Bakaan inaabidizi endaso-awesiinh miinawaa bakaan dibaajimaawag. Waaboozoowayaan gii-inaabadadoon da-aanziyaanikeng. Da-nandagaagwe eta wenda-manezid anishinaabe. Amik gii-wiindamaage ge-inakamigizid giishpin nisigod. Nibiikaang da-apagijigaadewan okanan wii-izhi-aanikie-ozhichigaazod amik.
Da-batayiinowag amikwag yo'ow izhichigenid anishinaaben.

annotation.text: Small Game Tradition and Custom
As with big game, a first kill feast was the tradition when hunting small game. Each animal had its own use and stories.

For example, rabbit skins were used to make diapers. Porcupines could only be hunted if there was extreme need. The beaver requested that when their lives were taken, their bones were to be thrown back in the water, where they will turn into another beaver.
By following this request, there would always be an abundance of beaver.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.8.010 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.801

section.heading: Open and Closed Season
section.text: A closed season is hereby established for the hunting and trapping of small game except for the open season specified in Section CSV.1.8.070 of this ordinance.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.8.020 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.802

section.heading: Hunting/Trapping During Closed Season Prohibited
section.text: Except as otherwise expressly provided by this ordinance, no member or duly authorized non-member shall hunt or trap small game within the exterior boundaries of the Lac Courte Oreilles Reservation and off-reservation lands under the jurisdiction and purview of the Lac Courte Oreilles Tribe during the closed season.

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.8.030 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.803

section.heading: Number of Small Game Available for Harvest
section.text: There shall be no limits on the harvest of small game during the open season, except the Tribal Governing Board reserves the right to impose limits that the tribal conservation department determines is in the best interest of the Tribe to do so.

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.8.040 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.804

section.heading: Small Game Harvest Permits
section.text: No member or duly authorized non-member shall hunt or trap small game pursuant to this subchapter without possessing a valid small game harvest permit approved by the Tribal Governing Board which may incorporate such other terms and conditions as the tribal conservation department deems necessary or appropriate. Such a permit may be the member's tribal identification card required by Section CSV.1.3.030(c) of this ordinance.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.8.050 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.805

para.text: No member or duly authorized non-member who has harvested small game pursuant to this ordinance, shall fail or refuse to provide a harvest report, data, or such other relevant harvest information, as may be requested by a tribal conservation warden, tribal law enforcement officer or the tribal conservation department.

No member or duly authorized non-member shall provide information to a tribal conservation warden, tribal law enforcement officer or the tribal conservation department which the member or duly authorized non-member knows, or has reason to know, is false or misleading.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.8.060 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.806

section.heading: Small Game Seasons; Specific Regulations
section.text: Upon the determination of the tribal conservation department and the corresponding approval of the Tribal Governing Board, the small game harvest season may be changed if it is in the best interest of the Tribe to do so. All dates given in this section are inclusive:

para.text: Annual small game trapping seasons for the time period provided in Section CSV.1.8.070(b), and annual small game hunting seasons for the time period provided in Section CSV.1.8.070(c), are hereby established.
For the purposes of small game trapping, the season for all species shall commence on October 1 at 12:00 a.m. and closes on April 30 at 11:59 p.m.
For the purposes of small game hunting, the season for all species shall be year around.

Notwithstanding, the tribal conservation department may restrict the hunting of otter in any way it deems necessary at any time. Restrictions may include but are not limited to specifying the seasons in which hunting is permitted, specifying the gender of an animal to be killed, specifying the number of animals that may be killed, or specifying the location where harvest is permitted.

Notwithstanding any other provision of this section, nothing in this section shall be construed to infringe upon the issuance of a permit according to the traditions and custom of the Tribe pursuant to Section CSV.1.1.090 of this ordinance.

Notwithstanding any other provision of this section, nothing in this section shall be construed to authorize small game harvest or the opening of a small game harvest season contrary to an Emergency Closure Order issued pursuant to Section CSV.1.3.300 of this ordinance.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.8.070 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.807

section.heading: Small Game Harvest Hours
section.text: There shall be no limits on small game harvest hours during the open season, except the Tribal Governing Board reserves the right to impose limits or site specific harvest hours that the tribal conservation department determines is in the best interest of the Tribe to do so.

section.heading: Small Game Harvest Within Restricted Tribal Areas Prohibited
section.text: Pursuant to Section CSV.1.3.210(a) of this ordinance, no member or duly authorized non-member shall hunt or trap small game within restricted areas.

section.heading: Hunting and Trapping on Non-Member Fee Lands Prohibited
section.text: Pursuant to Section CSV.1.3.020 of this ordinance, no member or duly authorized non-member shall hunt or trap small game on any non-member fee land except where the non-member land owner has consented to tribal hunting.

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.8.100 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.810

para.text: No member or non-member shall molest or break open the house, lodge hole, nest, burrow, or den of a badger, beaver, mink, or raccoon, whether occupied or not.
No member or non-member shall set a trap on a beaver dam or lodge unless the trap is fully submerged under water.

No member or non-member shall harvest pine martens or wolves within the exterior boundaries of the Lac Courte Oreilles Reservation or the off-reservation lands under the jurisdiction and purview of the Lac Courte Oreilles Tribe, except upon a showing of extreme need pursuant to Section CSV.1.1.100 of this ordinance.

Notwithstanding any other provision of this section, nothing in this section shall be construed to infringe upon the issuance of permit according to the traditions and custom of the Tribe pursuant to Section CSV.1.1.090 of this ordinance.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.8.110 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.811

section.heading: Artificial Light or Shining Small Game
section.text: Pursuant to Section CSV.1.3.150 of this ordinance, the use of artificial light for small game hunting is permitted, provided it is not within a safety zone as defined in Section CSV.1.2.010(hhh) of this ordinance. Member and duly authorized non-member compliance with the use of a safe zone of fire as defined in Section CSV.1.2.010(ggg) of this ordinance and an adequate backstop as defined in Section CSV.1.2.010(a) of this ordinance shall be considered safe hunting, otherwise no member or duly authorized non-member shall hunt and shine small game in such a manner so as to put human lives in danger, and a member or duly authorized non-member must take reasonable precautions to refrain from hunting dangerously.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.8.120 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.812

para.text: No member or duly authorized non-member shall trap pursuant to this ordinance without affixing to each trap or snare the user's tribal identification number or tribal trapping identification number.

Any trap or snare which is un-affixed with the user's tribal identification number or tribal trapping identification number, except snares set in accordance with Section CSV.1.8.180(a)(13) of this ordinance, shall be immediately seized and confiscated, and the owner or member using or attending the un-affixed trap shall be subject to citation for a violation of the provisions of Section CSV.1.8.130(a).

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.8.130 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.813

para.text: No member or duly authorized non-member shall harvest upon a trap line without a trap line site permit valid for a designated trap line or for such other location as established by the tribal conservation department.

The tribal conservation department may issue a trap line site permit to one or more members or duly authorized non-members and may impose such terms and conditions as it deems necessary or appropriate.
No member or duly authorized non-member shall fail to comply with the terms and conditions of a trap line site permit.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.8.140 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.814

section.heading: Incidental Take
section.text: Any member or duly authorized non-member incidentally taking any animal by trapping except for the open season for that animal shall release the animal if possible. If the animal is not capable of being released, the member or duly authorized non-member must report the incident to the tribal conservation department within 72 hours. The department may require the animal to be turned in within 72 hours after the report is made after which the department may dispose of the animal for charitable or governmental purposes or return the animal to the member or duly authorized non-member at its discretion.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.8.150 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.815

section.heading: Transportation
section.text: Except when small game is being transported between the exterior boundaries of the Lac Courte Oreilles Reservation and off-reservation lands under the jurisdiction and purview of the Lac Courte Oreilles Tribe, no member or duly authorized non-member shall transport small game off-reservation without a transportation tag pursuant to Section CSV.1.3.120 of this ordinance.

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.8.160 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.816

section.heading: Specific Trapping Regulations
section.text: No member or duly authorized non-member shall:

para.text: Set out traps, snares, or restraining snares except during the open season.
Set out bait or scent for attracting furbearing animals except during the open season.
Use live bait or otherwise place bait that is readily accessible to raptors
Use water sets except during the open season.

Fail to check all trap, snare, or restraining snare sets and to remove all animals therein at least once every 3-days, except sets placed for weasels consisting of body gripping traps placed entirely in enclosures, with no opening larger than 1 ⅜ inch in diameter, and anchored to an immovable object shall be tended within a 4-day period following the last tending of the set. Any animal captured shall be removed from the set each time the trap is tended.

Set, place, or operate any trap other than a body-gripping or conibear type trap, enclosed trigger trap, snare, restraining snare, steel-jawed trap, or live-trap capable of capturing only one animal in a single setting for the purpose of taking furbearing animals, or a colony trap except for muskrat as follows, except incidentally harvested mink may be retained from a lawfully set colony trap:
The colony trap is not placed within three feet of any culvert.
The colony trap and set does not utilize bait.
The trap is not used in conjunction with any fencing, netting or other material that creates an underwater obstruction designed to force or channel any wild animal into the trap.

Set, place, or operate any body-gripping trap larger than 8" x 8" as measured from the maximum outside points of the effective width and height of the jaws of the trap on dry land or frozen water unless it is four feet (4') or more above ground or placed in a box or similar container with openings restricted to 8" x 8" or less as measured from the maximum outside points of the effective width and height of the container.
Set, place or operate any steel-jawed trap with a spread width of more than 8 inches.
Set, place or operate any steel-jawed trap with teeth except as a water set.

Set, place or operate any body-gripping trap greater than 8" x 8" as measured from the maximum outside points of the effective width and height of the jaws of the trap or 8" in diameter in the following locations:
Within 3 feet of any federal, state or county road right-of-way culvert unless completely submerged in water.
Within 3 feet of any woven or welded wire mesh type fence.
Within 100 yards of any building devoted to human occupancy without the owner's consent.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.8.170 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.817

section.heading: Specific Snaring and Restraining Snare Regulations

para.text: No member or duly authorized non-member shall trap small game by the use of a snare except in compliance with the following provisions:
Any snare must be anchored so that it may not be dragged.
Any snare must be tagged as in in accordance with Section CSV.1.8.130(a) of this ordinance.
No snare may be spring activated.
Any snare must be set in a manner which prevents an animal from being suspended unless it is attached to a drowning mechanism.
Any upland snare must be removed no later than March 31.
Any water set snare must be removed no later than March 31.

Except as provided in Section CSV.1.8.180(a)(13), any snare must have either a mechanical stop device which will prevent the snare loop size from becoming smaller than 2 ½ inches or a break-away mechanical lock.
Except as provided in Section CSV.1.8.180(a)(13), any snare must have a swivel device on the anchor end.
Except as provided in Section CSV.1.8.180(a)(13), any snare or cable wire may not have a diameter exceeding 1/8 inch.
No upland snare shall be set on a well defined deer trail.

No upland snare shall be set such that the bottom of the loop is more than 6" above the first surface or, when the ground is snow covered, more than 6" above the level of the adjoining trail. The measurement to the adjoining trail is the distance to the first surface beneath the bottom of the set upland snare where the surface is ground, ice, crusted or packed snow or any other hard material.
No upland snare shall be set with a loop size greater than 10" in diameter.
Members and duly authorized non-members may use braided picture wire snares without locks or swivels for the purpose of snaring rabbits or hares.
No member or duly authorized non-member shall trap small game by the use of a restraining snare except in compliance with the following provisions:
No restraining snare may be set, placed or operated for any species other than fox, coyote, and bobcat, except incidentally harvested raccoon may be retained from a lawfully set restraining snare.
No restraining snare may be set out or placed, whether set or sprung, during the closed season. Restraining snares may only be used from October 1 – April 30.

No restraining snare may be staked in a manner that allows the restraint device to reach any part of a fence, rooted woody vegetation greater than ½ inch diameter, or any other immovable object or stake that could cause entanglement.

No restraining snare may be set, placed or operated with the bottom of the set restraint cable loop less than 6 inches or greater than 12 inches above the first surface. The measurement to the surface is the distance to the first surface beneath the bottom of the set cable restraint where the surface is ground, ice, crusted or packed snow or any other hard material.
No restraining snare may be set, place or operate any cable restraining unless the noose cable and noose attachments conform to the following specifications:
Cable length may not exceed 7 feet.
Cable must be galvanized and include a swivel.
It must be non-spring activated.
Cable must be made of multiple strands of wire, with a diameter of 3/32 inch or larger.
Include a breakaway device or stop rated at 285 pounds or less.
Include a relaxing reverse-bend washer lock with a minimum outside diameter of 1¼ inches.

Include cable stops affixed to the cable to ensure that the portion of the cable, which makes up the noose loop, may not be longer than 38 inches when fully open, or less than 8 inches when fully closed.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.8.180 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.818

section.heading: Possession and Sale of Live Small Game Animals

para.text: As used in this section, the following terms shall be construed to apply as follows:
"Control temporarily" means to possess a small game animal for a limited period of time for one of the following purposes:
Removal or transportation of a small game animal from one location to a more appropriate location;
Restraint or transportation of a small game animal for treatment or medical care; or
Restraint or transportation of a small game animal for game censuses, surveys or other purposes authorized by the Tribe;
"Possess" means to own, restrain, keep in captivity or transport a small game animal.

Except as otherwise authorized by law or as provided in Section CSV.1.8.190(c) and (4), no member or duly authorized non-member shall possess, or sell or otherwise transfer to any person, any live small game animal and any member or duly authorized non-member who takes any small game animal shall kill the animal when it is taken or shall immediately release the animal.

A member or duly authorized non-member may control temporarily a live small game animal for one of the purposes described in Section CSV.1.8.190(a)(1), but not for the purpose of selling the live animal.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.8.190 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.819

section.heading: Shipment of Furs
section.text: No member or duly authorized non-member shall send or ship any fur from an animal harvested pursuant to this subchapter unless all fur shipments are marked on the outside of the package showing the number and kinds of hides in the shipment and the name and address of the shipper.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.8.200 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.820

section.heading: Sale of Small Game Authorized
section.text: Nothing in this ordinance shall be construed to prohibit any member from selling the carcass, or any part thereof, of any lawfully harvested small game animal to any person.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.8.210 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.821

section.heading: Authorization for Closure
section.text: Pursuant to Section CSV.1.3.300 of this ordinance, the Director of the tribal conservation department is thereby delegated the authority to close any area to the harvesting of any small game species prior to the season's closing date, generally or with respect to a particular location, whenever in his or her professional opinion and judgment the continuation of the harvest is likely to result in a harvest exceeding the Tribe's harvest goals or may otherwise cause biological harm to the population of any small game species.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.8.220 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.822

section.heading: Sharing of Equipment/Assisting Tribal Member
section.text: No member or duly authorized non-member shall share any small game hunting or trapping equipment with or otherwise be assisted while small game hunting or trapping by any person who is not a member except as provided in Section CSV.1.3.290 of this ordinance.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.8.230 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.823

para.text: Permit Required. No member or duly authorized non-member shall hunt wild turkeys without possessing a valid small game harvest permit approved by the Tribal Governing Board issued pursuant to the provisions of this subchapter. Such a permit may be the member's tribal identification card required by Section CSV.1.3.030(c) of this ordinance.
Season. No member or duly authorized non-member shall harvest any wild turkeys except during the open season which shall be as follows (all dates are inclusive):
Fall Season: Day after Labor Day to December 31.
Spring Season: April 1 to May 31.

Number of Wild Turkeys Available for Harvest. There shall be no limits on the harvest of wild turkeys during the open season, except the Tribal Governing Board reserves the right to impose limits that the tribal conservation department determines is in the best interest of the Tribe to do so.
Bag Limit. None
Methods of Turkey Harvest. No member or duly authorized non-member shall hunt wild turkeys:
By any means other than a .22 caliber rifle, shotgun or muzzle-loading shotgun fired from the shoulder, or a bow and arrow or a crossbow.
With live decoys for the purposes of enticing wild turkeys.
Wild Turkey Harvest Information.

No member or duly authorized non-member who has harvested wild turkeys pursuant to this ordinance, shall fail or refuse to provide a harvest report, data, or such other relevant harvest information, as may be requested by a tribal conservation warden, tribal law enforcement officer or the tribal conservation department.

No member or duly authorized non-member shall provide information to a tribal conservation warden, tribal law enforcement officer or the tribal conservation department which the member or duly authorized non-member knows, or has reason to know, is false or misleading.

Other Restrictions Applicable. While hunting wild turkeys, no member shall fail to comply with the other restrictions applicable to hunting generally or to small game hunting specifically, which are not modified or otherwise affected by the provisions of this section.

Authorization for Closure. Pursuant to Section CSV.1.3.300 of this ordinance, the Director of the tribal conservation department is thereby delegated the authority to close any area to the harvesting of wild turkeys prior to the season's closing date, generally or with respect to a particular location, whenever in his or her professional opinion and judgment the continuation of the harvest is likely to result in a harvest exceeding the Tribe's harvest goals or may otherwise cause biological harm to the tribal wild turkey population.

annotation.doc: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-62
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 15-94

annotations.annotation: §CSV.1.8.240 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §1.824

para.text: No member shall hunt any bobwhite quail, hungarian partridge, pheasant, ruffed grouse or sharp-tailed grouse with a rifle (other than a .22 caliber rifle) or a shotgun loaded with a single ball or slug or shot larger than no. BB.
A member may hunt otter, fisher, marten, mink, and muskrat with any firearm .223 caliber or less.

section.heading: Use of Dogs in Hunting Small Game Permitted
section.text: A member or duly authorized non-member may hunt small game with the use of dogs.
