section.heading: Definitions
section.text: For the purpose of this subchapter, the following terms shall be construed to apply as follows:

para.text: "Bow" shall have the meaning provided in Section CSV.2.6.010(b).
"Crossbow" shall have the meaning provided in Section CSV.2.6.010(c).
"Firearm" shall have the meaning provided in Section CSV.2.6.010(d).

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.7.010 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.701

section.heading: Open and Closed Season
section.text: A closed season is hereby established for the hunting of bear except for the open season specified in Section CSV.2.7.060.

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.7.020 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.702

section.heading: Hunting During Closed Season Prohibited
section.text: Except as otherwise expressly provided by this ordinance, no member shall hunt bear off-reservation in the ceded territory during the closed season.

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.7.030 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.703

section.heading: Bear Management Zones
section.text: Bear Management Zones as set forth in the Commission's document entitled Tribal Management Units and Zones in the Wisconsin portion of the 1837 and 1842 Ceded Territories that is incorporated into this ordinance pursuant to Section CSV.2.3.270 are hereby established.

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.7.040 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.704

section.heading: Number of Bear Available for Harvest

para.text: Unless a tribal bear quota system is triggered by the provisions of Section CSV.2.7.050(b) of this section, there shall be no limit on the number of bear available for harvest under this ordinance.

The Commission's Biological Services Director, or his or her designate, is hereby delegated the authority to implement the provisions of Section XI.B of the Stipulation for Technical, Management and other Updates: Second Amendment of Stipulations Incorporated Into Final Judgment [hereafter referred to in this section as "Stipulation"] entered into between the tribal and state parties in Lac Courte Oreilles Band, et al. v. State of Wisconsin, et al., Case No. 74-C-313 (United States District Court, Western District of Wisconsin) regarding the implementation of a quota management system for bear.

When a tribal bear quota is required in a particular tribal bear management zone, the number of bear (tribal quota) which shall be available for harvest in each bear management zone pursuant to this ordinance for each twelve month period commencing July 1 and ending June 30 shall be limited to the number established pursuant to the Chippewa Intertribal Agreement Governing Resource Management and Regulation of Off-Reservation Treaty Rights in the Ceded Territory.
When a tribal bear quota is required, no member shall hunt bear in any bear management zone which has been closed to further bear hunting pursuant to Section CSV.2.7.270.

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.7.050 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.705

section.heading: General Bear Hunting Prohibited; Extreme Need Bear Season Specific Regulations

para.text: No member shall hunt bears during the annual season, except upon a showing of extreme need. Upon a showing of extreme need, the Tribal Governing Board may issue a permit for the harvest of Bear subject to the provisions of this ordinance during the annual season. The requesting member may use the services of another member to harvest the bear for them, in which case both the requesting member and the assisting member must be named on the permit.
All dates given in this section are inclusive.
Closed Season. No member shall hunt bear from November 1 through Labor Day.
Firearm, Bow, and Crossbow Season. An annual firearm, bow and crossbow season is hereby established, upon a showing of extreme need, commencing on the day after Labor Day and extending to October 31.

Nothing in this section shall be construed to authorize bear hunting or the opening of a bear hunting season contrary to an Emergency Closure Order issued pursuant to Section CSV.2.3.310 [Emergency Closure].

Notwithstanding any other provision of this section, nothing in this section shall be construed to infringe upon the issuance of permit according to the traditions and custom of the Tribe pursuant to Section CSV.2.1.090 of this ordinance.

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.7.060 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.706

para.text: No member shall hunt bear pursuant to this ordinance without possessing a valid bear hunting permit. Such a permit may be the member's tribal identification card required by Section CSV.2.3.020(b).
Except as provided in Section CSV.2.7.130 [Group Bear Hunting], no member shall hunt or shoot a bear without possessing a bear carcass tag valid for the hunting zone in which the bear is shot.
No member shall fail to affix a valid carcass tag to a bear immediately upon reducing the bear to possession.

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.7.070 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.707

para.text: A member who has killed a bear pursuant to this ordinance, or, in the instance of group hunting [Section CSV.2.6.120], whose carcass tag has been placed on the bear, shall register the bear by presenting it to a tribal registration station no later than 5:00 p.m. of the third working day after the killing.

Upon registering a bear pursuant to this section, the registering official shall affix a registration tag and duly record in an appropriate manner all information required to be provided by the member at the time of registration.

A member registering a bear shall provide the registering official with the following information: the deer management unit and county where the bear was taken, the date when the bear was taken, the tribal identification number of the member taking the bear and any other relevant information requested by the registering official.

No member shall register a bear except by presenting the entire carcass to the registering official or, in the alternative, by presenting only the hide with claws, head and teeth attached thereto, provided the carcass tag is firmly affixed to the hide or any part thereof.
No person shall provide information to the registering official which the person knows, or has reason to know, is false or misleading.

Any tribal or Commission warden authorized pursuant to Section CSV.2.4.020 to enforce the provisions of this ordinance is authorized to register bear in the field provided such warden provides all registering information to a tribal registration station no later than 5:00 p.m. of the first working day after the field registration.

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.7.080 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.708

section.heading: Skinning/Preservation Intact
section.text: No member shall skin or butcher, other than for field dressing, a bear prior to registration unless the member leaves the claws, head and teeth attached to the hide.

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.7.090 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.709

section.heading: Permissible Methods
section.text: No member shall hunt bear except by the use of any firearm, bow or crossbow, the use of which is not prohibited by this ordinance.

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.7.100 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.710

section.heading: Firearms Restrictions
section.text: No member shall hunt bear with any firearm the use of which is prohibited pursuant to Section CSV.2.6.090 for hunting deer, while possessing more than one handgun, or with the use of buckshot.

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.7.110 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.711

section.heading: Bow/Crossbow Restrictions
section.text: No member shall hunt bear with a bow or crossbow not in compliance with the provisions of Section CSV.2.6.100.

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.7.120 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.712

para.text: As used in this section:
"Contact" means visual or voice contact without the aid of any mechanical or electronic amplifying device other than a hearing aid.
"Group bear hunting party" means 2 or more members lawfully hunting bear under this ordinance in a group all using firearms.
Any member of a group bear hunting party may kill a bear for another member of the group bear hunting party if both of the following conditions exist:
At the time and place of the kill, the member who kills the bear is in contact with the person for whom the bear is killed.
The member for whom the bear is killed possesses a current unused bear carcass tag valid for the bear management zone in which the bear is killed.

A member who kills a bear under Section CSV.2.7.130(b) shall ensure that a member of his or her group bear hunting party without delay attaches a bear carcass tag to the bear prior to moving or field dressing it. No member who kills a bear while group hunting shall leave the bear unattended until after it is properly tagged.

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.7.130 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.713

section.heading: Hunting with Non-Members
section.text: Except as provided in Section CSV.2.3.300 [Permissible Conduct/Assistance by Non-Members], no member may share with anyone who is not a member of a signatory tribe any tribal bear permit, carcass tag, gear, bait, or dogs, except that nothing in this ordinance shall be construed to prohibit a member from hunting with any person who is not a member of the Tribe or of another signatory tribe during the State of Wisconsin bear hunting season if that person has a state Class A or Class B bear license or is exempt from the need for a class B bear license under Wisconsin state law.

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.7.140 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.714

section.heading: Hunting Hours
section.text: No member shall hunt bear except during the hours established for hunting deer in Section CSV.2.6.120.

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.7.150 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.715

section.heading: Transportation
section.text: No member shall transport any bear in or on any motor driven vehicle prior to registration unless the bear is carried so that a portion of it is visible from a passing vehicle and in such manner that the tag attached to the bear cannot be handled or manipulated by any occupant of the vehicle.

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.7.160 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.716

section.heading: Hunting on Certain Public Lands Prohibited
section.text: No member shall hunt bear on any of the following public lands except as noted:

para.text: Designated public campgrounds, public beaches, and public picnic areas.
School forests, public landfills and public gravel pits where bear hunting is prohibited and where notice of the prohibition is clearly posted.
Public lands within incorporated areas except for those lands:
which are designated for bow and gun bear hunting; or
which are designated for bow bear hunting.
All state parks.
All wildlife refuges.

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.7.170 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.717

section.heading: Hunting on Certain Private Lands Prohibited
section.text: No member shall hunt bear on any privately-owned land except those lands which pursuant to Chapter 77, Wis. Stats., have been designated as Forest Croplands or Open Managed Forest Lands.

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.7.180 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.718

section.heading: Hunting Bear with Dogs
section.text: No member shall hunt bear with dogs except in accordance with the following provisions:

para.text: Dogs Marked. Any dog used to hunt bear must be tattooed or wear a collar with the owner's name and address attached.
Dog Packs. No more than six dogs in a single pack may be used to hunt bear regardless of the number of bear hunters and regardless of dog ownership.
Training Season. No member may train dogs by pursuing wild bear except from July 1 through August 30.

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.7.190 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.719

section.heading: Dens
section.text: No member shall hunt or shoot a bear in a den.

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.7.200 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.720

section.heading: Landfills
section.text: No member shall hunt or shoot bear in any dump or sanitary landfill.

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.7.210 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.721

section.heading: Cubs
section.text: No member may shoot, shoot at, or kill any bear cub or any adult bear accompanied by a cub or cubs.

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.7.220 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.722

para.text: No member who kills a bear pursuant to this ordinance shall remove a registration tag from the carcass until such time as the carcass is butchered or when the bear is prepared by a taxidermist.

No member who kills a bear pursuant to this ordinance shall dispose of the registration tag until the meat is consumed or except in accordance with the provisions of Section CSV.2.7.250(h) [Transfer of Tags Upon Sale].

Any person who receives any bear meat as a gift or pursuant to Section CSV.2.7.240(b)(1) or Section CSV.2.7.240(b)(2) [Sale to Members] from a member who retains a registration tag under this section is not required to possess a registration tag.

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.7.230 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.723

section.heading: Sale of Bear and Bear Parts

para.text: Head and skin.

Sale to Members. No member who has harvested a bear pursuant to this ordinance shall sell the head and skin, when severed from the rest of the carcass, of the bear to another member or to a member of another signatory tribe unless the head, claws and teeth remain attached to the skin, except as follows:

The member may sell any part of the head or skin, including teeth and claws, of a bear lawfully harvested pursuant to this ordinance to any other member provided no member who receives any part of a head or skin pursuant to this paragraph shall sell such parts to any person who is not a member of a signatory tribe; and

The member may sell any part of a head or skin, including teeth and claws, of a bear lawfully harvested pursuant to this ordinance to a member of any other signatory tribe provided that such other tribe prohibits its member who receives any part of a head or skin from selling such parts to any person who is not a member of a signatory tribe.

Sale to Non-members. No member who has harvested and a bear pursuant to this ordinance shall sell the head and skin, when severed from the rest of the carcass, of the bear to any person who is not a member or a member of another signatory tribe unless the head, claws, and teeth remain attached to the skin.
Meat. No member shall sell the meat of any bear killed pursuant to this ordinance, except as follows:

Sale to Members. Any member who has lawfully harvested and registered a bear pursuant to this ordinance may sell the meat of any carcass, or any part thereof, of the bear to any other member provided no member who receives the meat pursuant to this subsection shall sell such meat to any person who is not a member of a signatory tribe.

Sale to Members of Other Tribes. Any member who has lawfully harvested and registered a bear pursuant to this ordinance may sell the meat of any carcass, or any part thereof, of the bear to a member of any other signatory tribe provided that such other tribe prohibits its member who receives the meat pursuant to this subsection from selling the meat to any person who is not a member of a signatory tribe.

Sale to Non-members. A member who has lawfully harvested and registered a bear pursuant to this ordinance may sell to a person who is not a member of a signatory tribe only the whole carcass (except for the head, skin and viscera) of the bear, provided the member:
complies with the commercial harvest provisions of Section CSV.2.7.250; and
otherwise complies with the provisions of this ordinance applicable to bear hunting.
Teeth, Claws, Paws and Viscera.

Sale to Non-Members. No member shall sell to any person who is not a member of a signatory tribe any tooth, claw, paw or organ which has been severed from the carcass of any bear harvested pursuant to this ordinance.

Sale to Members. No member shall sell to another member or to a member of another signatory tribe any tooth, claw, paw or organ which has been severed from the carcass of any bear harvested by the member pursuant to this ordinance except as follows:

The member may sell any tooth, claw, paw or organ which has been severed from the carcass of a bear lawfully harvested pursuant to this ordinance to any other member provided no member who receives any such part pursuant to this paragraph shall sell the part to any person who is not a member of a signatory tribe; and

The member may sell any tooth, claw, paw or organ which has been severed from the carcass of a bear lawfully harvested pursuant to this ordinance to a member of any other signatory tribe provided that such other tribe prohibits its member who receives such part selling the part to any person who is not a member of a signatory tribe.

Sale to the Tribe. Any member who has lawfully harvested and registered a bear pursuant to this ordinance may sell any tooth, claw, paw or organ which has been severed from the carcass of the bear to the Tribe provided:
the Tribe complies with the provisions of Section CSV.2.7.240(c)(4), below; and
the member complies with the commercial harvest provisions of Section CSV.2.7.250.

The Tribe may purchase or otherwise obtain from a member who has lawfully harvested and registered a bear pursuant to this ordinance any tooth, claw, paw or organ which has been severed from the carcass of the bear and may sell such part to any person provided:

the Tribe maintains a record of all such transactions, including the name of the member, the name and address of the subsequent purchaser, the carcass tag and registration tag numbers of the bear which was lawfully harvested and the part or parts involved in the transaction; and
a bill of sale or other similar document indicating the date of the transaction, the parties to the transaction, and the part or parts involved in the transaction.

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.7.240 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.724

para.text: Purpose. The purpose of this section is to establish the regulations governing the harvest and registration of bear the meat of which, and the teeth, claws, paws or viscera when severed from the carcass of which, may be sold pursuant to this ordinance when subsequent sale or resale of the meat or such parts to non-members is contemplated.
Effective Date.
The provisions of this section shall not take effect until such time as the Tribal Governing Board specifically declares them effective by an enabling resolution.

No member shall sell any meat or sell any tooth, claw, paw or organ when severed from the carcass pursuant to this section prior to the effective date as declared by the Tribal Governing Board in accordance with Section CSV.2.7.250(b)(1).
Commercial Harvest Permit Application.

Any member who or a group of members which possesses a valid bear hunting permit may apply on such forms as the Tribe may prescribe to the tribal conservation department for an additional permit authorizing the harvest of bear for commercial purposes on the terms and conditions prescribed by this section.

Upon receipt of an application for a Commercial Harvest Permit, the tribal conservation department shall inform the Tribal Governing Board, or its designate pursuant to Section CSV.2.7.250(c)(6), below, and the Commission's Biological Services Division of the application, the bear management zone in which the applicant seeks to hunt, the time period during which the applicant seeks to hunt and such other relevant information as is included in the application.

The Commission's Biological Services Division shall, within 2 working days of receipt of notice of the application, inform the tribal conservation department and the Tribal Governing Board, or its designate pursuant to Section CSV.2.7.250(c)(6), below, of the number of bear available for harvest pursuant to this ordinance in the management zone requested by the applicant.

Within 3 working days of the receipt of this information from the Commission's Biological Services Division, the Tribal Governing Board, or its designate pursuant to Section CSV.2.7.250(c)(6), below, in consultation with the tribal conservation department and the Commission's Conservation Enforcement Division, shall grant or deny the application, and shall notify the applicant as soon as practicable of its decision.

The decision to grant or deny the application shall be exclusively within the discretion of the Tribal Governing Board, or its designate pursuant to Section CSV.2.7.250(c)(6), below, and a decision to grant the application may impose conditions required by the Tribe upon a Commercial Harvest Permit which are more restrictive than the conditions imposed by this section.

The Tribal Governing Board hereby designates its Voigt Intertribal Task Force Representative(s) to exercise its powers under this section. Any decision by such designate under this section is subject to review by the Tribal Governing Board upon request of the applicant.
Terms and Conditions of a Commercial Harvest Permit. A Commercial Harvest Permit:
may authorize the permittee to harvest no more than the number of bear available for harvest in any one bear management zone;
shall restrict the permittee's hunting of bear pursuant to the permit to only one bear management zone at any given time;

shall require a member to register all bear harvested pursuant to the permit at a tribal registration station located within the bear management zone for which the permit is valid or within an adjoining management zone provided the bear is transported directly to a registration station in that adjoining unit on federal and state highways; and
shall require that all members named on the Commercial Harvest Permit possess an official copy of the permit and at least one valid carcass tag while hunting pursuant to the permit.

Registration of Entire Carcass Required. When registering a bear under a Commercial Harvest Permit, a member shall present the entire bear carcass (except for the viscera) for registration to an authorized registering official and no registering official shall register a bear under this section unless the entire carcass (except for the viscera) is presented for registration.
Registration Tag Required. Upon registration, the registering official shall affix a commercial harvest registration tag to the carcass.

General Tagging and Registration Requirements Unaffected. Except as modified by the provisions of this section, the provisions of Section CSV.2.7.070 [Bear Hunting Permits/Tags] and Section CSV.2.7.080 [Bear Registration] shall apply to members hunting pursuant to a Commercial Harvest Permit.
Transfer of Entire Carcass Required.

No member shall sell to any person who is not a member of a signatory tribe any bear registered under this section without transferring the entire carcass of such bear, except for the head, skin and viscera, the registration tag, and such accompanying documents as the Tribe may require to the person to whom such bear is sold.

No member shall sell to any person who is not a member of a signatory tribe the head or skin of any bear registered under this section without transferring the entire skin with the head, claws and teeth attached, the registration tag if it has not been or will not be transferred pursuant to Section CSV.2.7.250(h)(1), and such accompanying documents as the Tribe may require to the person to whom the skin is sold. If the registration tag is not available for transfer under this subsection because of transfer pursuant to Section CSV.2.7.250(h)(1), the member shall transfer a document indicating the carcass tag and registration tag numbers of the bear from which the skin has been removed.

No member shall sell to the Tribe pursuant to Section CSV.2.7.240(c)(3) any organ of any bear registered under this section without transferring to the Tribe the information and documents required in Section CSV.2.7.240(c)(4).

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.7.250 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.725

section.heading: Shining
section.text: No member shall hunt bear while shining, as defined in Section CSV.2.3.140.

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.7.260 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.726

section.heading: Authorization for Closure
section.text: The Commission's Biological Services Director, or his or her designate, is hereby delegated the authority to close any bear management zone to bear hunting prior to the season's closing date, provided there remains no bear available for harvest under this ordinance in that zone.

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.7.270 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.727
This version of the code was originally adopted on pursuant to Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Resolution No. 90-62 on September 4, 1990.

Section CSV.2.7.040 was amended by the Stipulation for Technical, Management, and Other Updates: First Amendment of Stipulations Incorporated into Final Judgment and was adopted by the Voigt Intertribal Task Force on August 7, 2008.

Section CSV.2.7.050 was amended by the Stipulation for Technical, Management, and Other Updates: Second Amendment of Stipulations Incorporated in the Final Judgment and was adopted by the Voigt Intertribal Task Force on October 7, 2010.

Section CSV.2.7.080 was amended by the Stipulation for Technical, Management, and Other Updates: First Amendment of Stipulations Incorporated into Final Judgment and was adopted by the Voigt Intertribal Task Force on August 7, 2008.
Section CSV.2.7.140 was amended by Commission Order 2011-03 on October 6, 2011.

section.heading: Purpose
section.text: The purpose of this subchapter is to regulate off-reservation small game hunting and trapping in the ceded territory by members.

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.8.010 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.801

section.heading: Definitions
section.text: For the purpose of this subchapter, the following terms shall be construed to apply as follows:

para.text: "Bow" shall have the meaning prescribed in Section CSV.2.6.010(b).
"Restraining Snare" means while trapping to use a wire noose used for restraining furbearing animals which does not allow the device or trapped animal to reach unfrozen water.

"Colony Trap" means while trapping to use an enclosure device designed to allow the capture of one or more fur-bearing animals in a single setting as a drowning set. Entrance to the device is gained by one or more one-way entrances with overall dimensions of the trap no to exceed 6" (six inches) in width, 6" (six inches) in height and 36" (thirty-six inches) in length.
"Crossbow" shall have the meaning prescribed in Section CSV.2.6.010(c).
"Firearm" shall have the meaning prescribed in Section CSV.2.6.010(d).
"Hunt" or "Hunting" shall have the meaning prescribed in Section CSV.2.2.010(h) but shall not include trapping for the purposes of this subchapter.
"Trap", in addition to the meaning prescribed in Section CSV.2.2.010(o), means to trap or snare, including the use of a restraining snare.
"Unprotected Species" means:
Opossum, skunk, weasel, woodchuck;
Starlings, English sparrows, coturnix quail, chukar partridge and rock doves;
All other unprotected species as defined in Section CSV.2.2.010(r).

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.8.020 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.802

section.heading: Open and Closed Seasons
section.text: A closed season is hereby established for the hunting and trapping of small game except for the specified open season.

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.8.030 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.803

section.heading: Hunting/Trapping During Closed Season Prohibited
section.text: Except as otherwise expressly provided in this ordinance, no member shall hunt or trap small game off-reservation in the ceded territory during the closed season.

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.8.040 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.804

para.text: Fisher Management Zones as set forth in the Commission's document entitled Tribal Management Units and Zones in the Wisconsin portion of the 1837 and 1842 Ceded Territories that is incorporated into this ordinance pursuant to Section CSV.2.3.270 are hereby established.
No member shall hunt or trap fisher except in the management zones established by this section.

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.8.050 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.805

para.text: Unless a tribal otter, bobcat and fisher quota system is triggered by the provisions of Section CSV.2.8.060(b) of this section, there shall be no limit on the number of otter, bobcat and fisher available for harvest under this ordinance.

The Commission's Biological Services Director, or his or her designate, is hereby delegated the authority to implement the provisions of Section XI.C of the Stipulation for Technical, Management and other Updates: Second Amendment of Stipulations Incorporated Into Final Judgment [hereafter referred to in this section as "Stipulation" entered into between the tribal and state parties in Lac Courte Oreilles Band, et al. v. State of Wisconsin, et al., Case No. 74-C-313 (United States District Court, Western District of Wisconsin) regarding the implementation of a quota management system for otter, bobcat and fisher .

When a tribal otter and/or bobcat quota is required, or a tribal fisher quota is required in a particular tribal fisher management zone, the number of otter, bobcat and fisher (tribal quota) which shall be available for harvest pursuant to this ordinance for each twelve month period commencing July 1 and ending June 30 shall be limited to the number established pursuant to the Chippewa Intertribal Agreement Governing Resource Management and Regulation of Off-Reservation Treaty Rights in the Ceded Territory.

When a tribal otter and/or bobcat quota is required, no member shall hunt or trap otter and/or bobcat in the ceded territory when it has been closed to further otter and/or bobcat harvest pursuant to Section CSV.2.8.240.
When a tribal fisher quota is required, no member shall hunt or trap fisher in any fisher zone which have been closed to further fisher harvest pursuant to Section CSV.2.8.240.

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.8.060 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.806

para.text: No member shall hunt small game pursuant to this subchapter without possessing a valid small game hunting permit.
No member shall hunt otter, bobcat or fisher without possessing a valid carcass tag.
No member shall trap small game pursuant to this subchapter without possessing a valid small game trapping permit.
No member shall trap otter, bobcat or fisher without possessing a valid carcass tag.
No small game hunting or small game trapping permit shall be considered valid for hunting or trapping any fisher in a fisher management zone:
which is shown to be closed on the permit;
for which the permit is marked as invalid; or
on which any fisher management zone letter has been slit, punched through or otherwise crossed out in any fashion.
Except as provided in Section CSV.2.8.200 [Possession and Sale of Live Small Game Animals], no member shall move or field dress an otter, bobcat or fisher before affixing to it a valid carcass tag.

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.8.070 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.807

para.text: A member killing a fisher pursuant to this ordinance shall register the animal by presenting it to a tribal registration station no later than 5:00 p.m. of the third working day after killing if the animal was hunted or after retrieval if the animal was trapped.

A member killing an otter or bobcat pursuant to this ordinance shall notify a tribal registration station of the killing no later than 5:00 p.m. of the third working day after killing if the animal was hunted or after retrieval if the animal was trapped. The member shall present the animal for registration on the date and at the location specified by the registering official.

Upon registering an otter, bobcat or fisher pursuant to this section, the registering official shall, except as provided in Section CSV.2.8.200 [Sale and Possession of Live Small Game Animals], affix a registration tag and shall duly record in an appropriate manner all information required to be provided by the member at the time of registration.

A member registering an otter, bobcat or fisher shall provide the registering official with the following information: the sex of the animal taken, the deer management unit and county where the animal was taken, the date when the animal was taken, the tribal identification number of the member taking the animal and any other relevant information requested by the registering official.

No member shall register an otter, bobcat or fisher except by presenting the whole carcass to the registering official, or in the alternative, by providing the whole skin to the registering official provided the carcass tag is attached to the skin.
No member shall provide information to the registering official which the member knows, or has reason to know, is false or misleading.

Any tribal or Commission warden authorized pursuant to Section CSV.2.4.020 to enforce the provisions of this ordinance is authorized to register otter, bobcat or fisher in the field provided such warden transmits all registering information to a tribal registration station no later than the registration deadline established by Section CSV.2.8.080(a), above.

No member shall fail to transfer the carcass, except for the skin, of any fisher, bobcat or otter to the tribal conservation department or the Commission's Biological Services Division when requested unless the carcass was delivered to a licensed fur buyer.

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.8.080 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.808

para.text: Annual small game trapping seasons for the time periods provided in this subs. 2(b) and annual small game hunting seasons for the time periods provided in subs. 3(b) are hereby established.
For the purposes of small game trapping, seasons begin at 6:00 a.m. of the opening date and end at 11:59 p.m. of the closing date.

The small game trapping season for all species, except for otter, fisher, and beaver, listed in subs. 3(b) commences on October 1 and closes on March 31, the fisher trapping season commences on the Saturday nearest October 17 and closes on March 31, the otter trapping season commences on October 1 and closes on April 30, and the beaver trapping season commences on October 1 and closes on April 30.
For the purposes of small game hunting, seasons begin and end in accordance with the applicable hunting hours prescribed in Section CSV.2.8.100.
Specific small game hunting seasons (all dates are inclusive):
Bobcat October 1 - March 31
Beaver Year Around
Bobwhite Quail Day after Labor Day - March 31
Coyote Year Around
Cottontail Rabbit Year Around
Fisher No Open Hunting Season
Hungarian Partridge Day after Labor Day - March 31
Mink No Open Hunting Season
Muskrat No Open Hunting Season
Otter No Open Hunting Season
Pheasant Day after Labor Day - March 31
Raccoon Day after Labor Day - March 31
Red and Gray Fox Day after Labor Day - March 31
Red, Gray and Fox Squirrel Year Around
Ruffed Grouse Day after Labor Day - March 31
Sharp-Tailed Grouse Day after Labor Day - March 31
Snowshoe Hare Year Around
Unprotected Species Year Around
The daily bag limit for sharp-tailed grouse is one and no member shall harvest any sharp-tailed grouse in excess of this bag limit.

Nothing in this section shall be construed to authorize small game hunting or trapping or the opening of a small game hunting or trapping season for a particular species contrary to an Emergency Closure Order issued pursuant to Section CSV.2.3.310 [Emergency Closure].

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.8.090 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.809

para.text: Except where otherwise expressly authorized by this ordinance, no member shall hunt small game except during the hours prescribed by this section (all dates and times given are inclusive and all times refer to Central Standard Time and should be adjusted one hour as necessary to account for Daylight Savings Time).
Lawful small game hunting hours during open seasons are provided as follows:

From September 1 through March 31, for all small game animals except coyote, fox, raccoon, snowshoe hare, and unprotected species one-half hour before sunrise to 20 minutes after sunset or as otherwise provided by a GLIFWC Commission Order.
From April 1 through August 31, for all small game species except for wild turkeys, 24 hours per day, or as otherwise provided by a GLIFWC Commission Order.

For coyote, fox, raccoon, snowshoe hare and unprotected species, 24 hours per day, or as otherwise provided by a GLIFWC Commission Order except during the middle deer season established pursuant to Section CSV.2.6.070(c) when hunting hours shall be the same for small game and deer hunting.
For wild turkeys, hunting hours are:
Fall Season (established in Section CSV.2.8.260(b)(1)) – one-half hour before sunrise to 20 minutes after sunset; or as otherwise provided by a GLIFWC Commission Order and
Spring Season (established in Section CSV.2.8.260(b)(2)) – one-half hour before sunrise to sunset or as otherwise provided by a GLIFWC Commission Order.
Lawful small game hunting hours shall be determined in accordance with the Tribal Hunting Hours Zone/Table attached to this ordinance after Subchapter CSV.2.14.

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.8.100 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.810

section.heading: Hunting and Trapping on Certain Public Lands Prohibited
section.text: No member shall hunt or trap small game on any of the following lands except as noted:

para.text: Designated public campgrounds, public beaches and public picnic areas.
School forests, public landfills and public gravel pits where small game hunting is prohibited and where notice of the prohibition is clearly posted.
Public lands within incorporated areas except for those lands which are designated for small game hunting or trapping.

All state parks except as described in the following comprehensive tribal document as it may be amended from time to time, and is hereby adopted and incorporated in this ordinance as if fully set forth herein, and no member shall fail to comply with the closures and other restrictions established by this document:

text.em: Tribal State Park Hunting Opportunities in the Wisconsin portion of the 1837 and 1842 Ceded Territories (Version 1: January 2010).

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.8.110 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.811

section.heading: Hunting on Certain Private Lands Prohibited
section.text: No member shall hunt small game on any privately-owned land except those lands which, pursuant to Chapter 77.16, Wis. Stats., have been designated as Forest Croplands or Open Managed Forest Lands.

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.8.120 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.812

section.heading: Trapping on Certain Private Lands Prohibited

para.text: No member shall place a trap on any privately-owned land.

For the purposes of this section, "privately owned" means owned by a person or entity other than the Tribe, another signatory Tribe, or the State of Wisconsin or its political subdivisions, and includes the bed of any stream or flowage owned by such person or entity.

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.8.130 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.813

section.heading: Specific Small Game Hunting and Trapping Closed Areas and Refuges
section.text: No member shall hunt or trap small game in any wildlife refuge or closed area as established pursuant to Section CSV.2.3.270 contrary to the closures and restrictions established by that section.

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.8.140 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.814

section.heading: Small Game Hunting Prohibited Methods
section.text: While hunting small game, no member shall:

para.text: Use or possess any device designed or used for the purpose of driving rabbits out of their holes or dens;
Use or possess any ferret; or
Molest the nest or den of any squirrel.

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.8.150 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.815

section.heading: Shining Raccoon, Fox or Unprotected Species

para.text: No member shall hunt raccoon, fox or any unprotected species while shining as defined in Section CSV.2.3.140 except:
While hunting on foot during the open season for the animal hunted, a member may possess or use a flashlight at the point of kill; or
While on foot training a dog to hunt or track raccoon, fox or any unprotected species, a member may possess or use a flashlight.
No member shall hunt raccoon, fox or any unprotected species while shining during the middle deer season established pursuant to Section CSV.2.6.070(c).

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.8.160 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.816

para.text: No member shall trap pursuant to this ordinance without affixing to each trap or snare a metal tag upon which shall be stamped or engraved the trapper's name and address or tribal trapping identification number and the initials "LCO" indicating membership in the tribe.

Any trap or snare which is untagged shall be immediately seized and confiscated, and the owner or member using or attending the untagged trap shall be subject to citation for a violation of the provisions of Section CSV.2.8.170(a).

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.8.170 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.817

section.heading: Specific Trapping Regulations
section.text: No member shall:

para.text: Set out traps, snares, or restraining snares except during the open season.
Set out bait or scent for attracting furbearing animals except during the open season.
Use sight-exposed bait, visible from above, consisting of feathers, animal flesh, fur, hide or entrails within 25 feet of any trap, snares, or restraining snares.
Use water sets except during the open season for muskrat, beaver or otter.
Fail to check all dry land sets, snares, or restraining snares and to remove all animals therein at least once each day.
Place on the ice any artificial house or den, or place therein any trap or snare, which has the purpose or may have the effect of taking furbearers.

Set, place, or operate any trap other than a body-gripping or conibear type trap, enclosed trigger trap, snare, restraining snare, steel-jawed trap, or live-trap capable of capturing only one animal in a single setting for the purpose of taking furbearing animals, or a colony trap except for muskrat as follows, except incidentally harvested mink may be retained from a lawfully set colony trap:.
The colony trap is set entirely underwater at all times.
The colony trap is not placed within three feet of any culvert.
The colony trap and set does not utilize bait.
The trap is not used in conjunction with any fencing, netting or other material that creates an underwater obstruction designed to force or channel any wild animal into the trap.

Set, place or operate except as a water set at least half submerged in water any body- gripping or conibear type trap larger than 7.5 inches x 7.5 inches as measured from the maximum outside points of the effective width and height of the jaws of the trap.
Set, place or operate any steel-jawed trap with a spread width of more than 8 inches.
Set, place or operate any steel-jawed trap with teeth except as a water set.

Set, place or operate any body-gripping or conibear type greater than 7.5 inches x 7.5 inches as measured from the maximum outside points of the effective width and height of the jaws of the trap or 7.5 inches in diameter in the following locations:
Within 3 feet of any federal, state or county road right-of-way culvert unless completely submerged in water.
Within 3 feet of any woven or welded wire mesh type fence.
Within 100 yards of any building devoted to human occupancy without the owner's consent.

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.8.180 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.818

section.heading: Specific Snaring and Restraining Snare Regulations

para.text: No member shall trap small game by the use of a snare except in compliance with the following provisions:
Any snare must be anchored so that it may not be dragged.
Any snare must be tagged as in Section CSV.2.8.170(a).
No snare may be spring activated.
Any snare must be set in a manner which prevents an animal from being suspended unless it is attached to a drowning mechanism.
Any upland snare must be removed no later than March 31.
Any water set snare must be removed no later than March 31.

Except as provided in Section CSV.2.8.190(a)(13), any snare must have either a mechanical stop device which will prevent the snare loop size from becoming smaller than 2½ inches or a break-away mechanical lock.
Except as provided in Section CSV.2.8.190(a)(13), any snare must have a swivel device on the anchor end.
Except as provided in Section CSV.2.8.190(a)(13), any snare or cable wire may not have a diameter exceeding 1/8 inch.
No upland snare shall be set on a well defined deer trail.
No upland snare shall be set such that the bottom of the loop is more than 6 inches above the ground or, when the ground is snow covered, more than 6 inches above the level of the adjoining trail.
No upland snare shall be set with a loop size greater than 10 inches in diameter.
Members may use braided picture wire snares without locks or swivels for the purpose of snaring rabbits or hares.
No member shall trap small game by the use of a restraining snare except in compliance with the following provisions:
No restraining snare may be set, placed or operated for any species other than fox, coyote, and bobcat.
No restraining snare may be set out or placed, whether set or sprung, during the closed season. Restraining snares may only be used from October 1 – March 31 for bobcat, coyote and fox.

No restraining snare may be staked in a manner that allows the restraint device to reach any part of a fence, rooted woody vegetation greater than ½ inch diameter, or any other immovable object or stake that could cause entanglement.

No restraining snare may be set, placed or operated with the bottom of the loop less than 6 inches or greater than 12 inches above the first surface beneath the bottom of the set restraint snare loop, where the surface is ground, ice, crusted or packed snow or any other hard surface.
No restraining snare may be set, place or operate any cable restraining unless the noose cable and noose attachments conform to the following specifications:
Cable length may not exceed 7 feet.
Cable must be galvanized and include a swivel.
It must be non-spring activated.
Cable must be made of multiple strands of wire, with a diameter of 3/32 inch or larger.
Include a breakaway device or stop rated at 285 pounds or less.
Include a relaxing reverse-bend washer lock with a minimum outside diameter of 1¼ inches.

Include cable stops affixed to the cable to ensure that the portion of the cable, which makes up the noose loop, may not be longer than 38 inches when fully open, or less than 8 inches when fully closed.

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.8.190 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.819

section.heading: Possession and Sale of Live Small Game Animals

para.text: As used in this section, the following terms shall be construed to apply as follows:
"Control temporarily" means to possess a small game animal for a limited period of time for one of the following purposes:
Removal or transportation of a small game animal from one location to a more appropriate location;
Restraint or transportation of a small game animal for treatment or medical care;
Restraint or transportation of a small game animal for game censuses, surveys or other purposes authorized by the Tribe; or
Restraint, transportation or possession of a small game animal for the purpose of selling or otherwise transferring the animal to a person who is legally authorized to possess the live animal.
"Possess" means to own, restrain, keep in captivity or transport a small game animal.

Except as otherwise authorized by law or as provided in Section CSV.2.8.200(c) and (4), no member shall possess, or sell or otherwise transfer to any person, any live small game animal and any member who takes any small game animal shall kill the animal when it is taken or shall immediately release the animal.

A member may control temporarily a live small game animal provided that a member who controls temporarily a live small game animal for the purposes of selling or otherwise transferring the live animal complies with the provisions of Section CSV.2.8.200(d) and (5).
A member may sell or otherwise transfer a live small game animal which was lawfully taken during the open season for that animal provided:

the member sells or transfers the animal within three (3) days of when the animal was taken or retrieved and, if the animal is not sold or transferred within this period, the member must kill the animal;
the person to whom the live small game animal is sold or transferred is legally authorized to possess the live animal and such person presents evidence of that authorization to the member;

in addition to the requirements of Section CSV.2.3.260 [Records of Commercial Transactions Required], the member maintains a record of each sale or transfer, the name and address of the purchaser or transferee, the type of authorization or license held by the purchaser or transferee and its number, if any, the date of the sale or transfer, and a description of the animal involved;

if the animal taken for the purpose of selling or transferring pursuant to this section is an otter, bobcat or fisher, the member must attach the carcass tag to the container in which the animal is transported to the registration station;

any otter, bobcat or fisher which is taken for the purpose of selling or transferring pursuant to this section shall be registered in accordance with the provisions of Section CSV.2.8.080 [Otter, Bobcat and Fisher Registration] provided the member retains the registration tag and such other registration documents provided by the registering official until such time as the animal is sold, transferred or otherwise disposed of;
the member transfers to the purchaser or transferee the registration tag and other required registration documents for any otter, bobcat or fisher sold or transferred pursuant to this section; and
the member treats it in a humane manner and confines the animal under sanitary conditions with proper and adequate housing, care, food and fresh water.

Any otter, bobcat or fisher sold or otherwise transferred pursuant to this section shall be counted against the quota for the particular species, and, any fisher shall count against the quota of the fisher management zone in which the fisher was taken.

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.8.200 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.820

section.heading: Incidental Take
section.text: Any member taking any animal by trapping except during the open season for that animal shall surrender the animal as soon as practicable to the tribal conservation department, or shall immediately release the animal if the animal was live trapped.

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.8.210 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.821

section.heading: Shipment of Furs
section.text: No member shall send or ship any fur from an animal harvested pursuant to this subchapter unless all fur shipments are marked on the outside of the package showing the number and kinds of hides in the shipment and the name and address of the shipper.

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.8.220 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.822

para.text: Nothing in this ordinance shall be construed to prohibit any member from selling the carcass, or any part thereof, of any lawfully harvested small game animal to any person.
The provisions of Section CSV.2.3.260 [Records of Commercial Transactions] shall not apply to the sale of the fur of any small game furbearing species.

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.8.230 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.823

section.heading: Authorization for Closure
section.text: The Commission's Biological Services Director, or his or her designate, is hereby delegated the authority:

para.text: to close the small game hunting and trapping season for otter, bobcat or fisher, provided there remains no otter, bobcat or fisher available for harvest under this ordinance; and
to close any fisher management zone prior to the season's closing date, provided there remains no fisher available for harvest under this ordinance in that zone.

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.8.240 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.824

section.heading: Sharing of Equipment/Assisting Tribal Member
section.text: No member shall share any small game hunting or trapping equipment with or otherwise be assisted while small game hunting or trapping by any person who is not a member or a member of another signatory tribe except as provided in Section CSV.2.3.300 [Permissible Conduct/ Assistance by Non-Members].

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.8.250 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.825

para.text: Permit Required. No member shall hunt wild turkeys without possessing a valid small game hunting permit issued pursuant to the provisions of this subchapter.
Season. No member shall harvest any wild turkeys except during the open season which shall be as follows (all dates are inclusive):
Fall Season: Day after Labor Day to December 31.
Spring Season: Wednesday nearest April 13 for forty-two (42) consecutive days.
For State Park Hunting Zones, the spring season will be limited to the first three periods, which will open on the Wednesday nearest April 13 for twenty-one (21) consecutive days.
Number of Wild Turkeys Available for Harvest.
Unless a wild turkey quota system is triggered by the provisions of subs. 3(b) of this section, there shall be no limit on the number of wild turkeys available for harvest under this ordinance.

The Commission's Biological Services Director, or his or her designate, is hereby delegated the authority to implement the provisions of Section III.A.1 of the Stipulation for Technical, Management and other Updates: First Amendment of the Stipulations Incorporated into the Final Judgment [hereafter referred to in this section as "Stipulation"] entered into between the tribal and state parties in Lac Courte Oreilles Band, et al. v. State of Wisconsin, et al., Case No. 74-C-313 (United States District Court, Western District of Wisconsin) regarding the implementation of a quota management system for wild turkeys.

When a tribal wild turkey quota is required in a particular wild turkey management zone, the number of wild turkeys (tribal quota) which shall be available for harvest in that zone pursuant to this ordinance for each twelve month period commencing September 1 and ending August 31 shall be limited to the number established pursuant to the Chippewa Intertribal Agreement Governing Resource Management and Regulation of Off-Reservation Treaty Rights in the Ceded Territory.

When a tribal wild turkey quota is required, no member shall hunt wild turkeys in any wild turkey management zone which has been closed to further wild turkey hunting pursuant to Section CSV.2.8.260(i).
Bag Limit. No member shall harvest more than 3 wild turkeys per day.
Wild Turkey Management Zones.

The Commission's Biological Services Division Director, or his or her designee, is hereby delegated the authority to implement the provisions of Sections VII.A and VII.B.5 of the Stipulation for Technical, Management and other Updates [hereafter referred to in this section as "Stipulation"] entered into between the tribal and state parties in Lac Courte Oreilles Band, et al. v. State of Wisconsin, et al., Case No. 74-C-313 (United States District Court, Western District of Wisconsin) regarding tribal turkey management zones within the ceded territory consistent with the Stipulation's requirements.

Such wild turkey management zones shall be included in the Commission's document entitled Tribal Management Units and Zones in the Wisconsin portion of the 1837 and 1842 Ceded Territories that is incorporated into this ordinance pursuant to Section CSV.2.3.270.
Methods of Turkey Harvest. No member shall hunt wild turkeys:
By any means other than a shotgun or muzzle-loading shotgun fired from the shoulder, or a bow and arrow or a crossbow.

With the aid of recorded bird calls or sounds or electrically amplified imitations of bird calls or sounds, except when a member possesses a valid disabled hunter permit pursuant to Section CSV.2.3.320 of this ordinance.
[Open].
With live decoys for the purposes of enticing wild turkeys.
Registration Required.
A member killing a wild turkey pursuant to this ordinance shall register the wild turkey no later than 5:00 p.m. of the third working day following the killing.

No member shall fail to inform the tribal registration station of the location, including the wild turkey management zone if applicable, where the animal was killed or to provide such other information as is required by the registering official.
No person shall provide information to the registering official which the person knows, or has reason to know, is false or misleading.

Any tribal or Commission warden authorized pursuant to Section CSV.2.4.020 to enforce the provisions of this ordinance is authorized to register wild turkeys in the field provided such warden provides all registering information to a tribal registration station no later than 5:00 p.m. of the first working day after field registration.
Other Restrictions Applicable.

While hunting wild turkeys, no member shall fail to comply with the other restrictions applicable to hunting generally or to small game hunting specifically, such as hunting hours, which are not modified or otherwise affected by the provisions of this section.
No member shall hunt wild turkeys in any area designated pursuant to Section CSV.2.8.260(h)(2)(B) as a wild turkey reintroduction area.

The Commission's Biological Services Director, or his or her designee, is hereby authorized, upon prior consultation with the Tribe, to designate certain areas within the ceded territory as wild turkey reintroduction areas in which the hunting of wild turkeys shall be prohibited.

Authorization for Closure. The Commission's Biological Services Director, or his or her designee, is hereby delegated the authority to close any wild turkey management zone to turkey hunting prior to the season's closing date, provided there remains no turkeys available for harvest under this ordinance in that zone.

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.8.260 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.826

para.text: No member shall hunt any bobwhite quail, hungarian partridge, pheasant, ruffed grouse or sharp-tailed grouse with a rifle or a shotgun loaded with a single ball or slug or shot larger than no. BB.
A member may hunt ruffed grouse with a .22 caliber rim-fire rifle.

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.8.270 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.827

section.heading: Definitions
section.text: For the purpose of this subchapter, the following terms shall be construed as follows:

para.text: "Dip Net" means a piece of netting suspended from a round or square frame not exceeding 8 feet in diameter or 8 feet in width and 8 feet in length.

"Fyke Net" or "Trap Net" means a device constructed of netting which may employ a frame, wings or wings and leads, and which directs the movement of fish through a funnel of netting into inner hearts or built-in forebays wherein the fish are trapped by their own movement.
"Gillnet" means any net set to capture fish by entanglement rather than entrapment.
"Hook and Line" means a rod and reel or similar device including a tip up and hand held lines, and includes trolling.
"Ice Fishing" means fishing though an artificial hole in the ice.
"Net" means any dip net, fyke net, gill net or seine and when used as a verb means to fish with any of these nets.
"Open Water Fishing" means all fishing other than fishing through an artificial hole in the ice.

"Seine" means a net of mesh no larger than 2" stretch measure, with floats at the top and weights at the bottom, such that it hangs vertically in the water, and which is drawn through the water to capture fish by encircling them rather than entangling them.

"Spear" means a pole tipped with a minimum of three barbed tines which are a minimum of 4-1/2" long and each tine having a barb extending perpendicular which is greater than 1/8 inch; and when used as a verb, means reducing or attempting to reduce to possession fish by means of a hand held spear or other similar device which is directed by the spearer for the purpose of impaling the target fish, and may include the use of artificial light. When used as a verb, spear shall also mean snagging for the purpose of this ordinance.
"Set or Bank Pole" means a pole used for fishing from the banks of lakes or rivers in compliance with the provisions of Section CSV.2.9.090.
"Setline" means a line used for fishing in compliance with the provisions of Section CSV.2.9.090.
"Snagging" means attempting to take or reduce a fish to possession by hooking a fish in a place other than the mouth by the use of a hook and line or any other device which is not a net or spear.
"Troll" means to fish from a motor-driven boat when the motor is running, from any boat in tow of a motor-driven boat when the motor is running, or from a sailboat when in motion.
"Unattended" means beyond visual contact with the aid of a magnifying device for a period of more than 1/2 hour.

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.9.010 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.901

section.heading: Open and Closed Season
section.text: A closed season is hereby established for fishing except for the open seasons specified in this subchapter.

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.9.020 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.902

section.heading: Number of Fish Available for Harvest
section.text: The number of any species of fish (tribal quota) which shall be available for harvest pursuant to this ordinance for each twelve month period from April 1 through March 31 shall be limited to the number established pursuant to the Chippewa Intertribal Agreement Governing Resource Management and Regulation of Off-Reservation Treaty Rights in the Ceded Territory.

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.9.030 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.903

para.text: No member shall fish pursuant to this ordinance without possessing a valid fishing permit.

No member shall fish with the use of a spear, except while ice fishing, or net pursuant to this ordinance without possessing a spearing or netting permit bearing the member's tribal identification number and valid for the date on which and the location in which the member is spearing or netting.

annotations.annotation: §CSV.2.9.040 was formerly codified as VI LCOTCL §2.904

section.heading: Seasons, Methods, Bag Limits, and Size Limits

para.text: No member shall take, catch, kill or fish for any species of fish in excess of the bag limit, by means other than those enumerated, during other than the open season, below the minimum size limit, above the maximum size limit or in locations other than those established by this section.
For the purposes of bag limits, "day" shall mean a continuous 24 hour period consistent with the nature of the harvest activity involved.

Except as provided in Section CSV.2.9.050(d), below, the following table hereby establishes the open season, permissible methods, daily bag limits and size limits for the enumerated species of fish in the identified locations:
